info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 12:44AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL KENTON, CAMPBELL, CENTRAL BOONE, NORTHEASTERN PENDLETON, SOUTHEASTERN HAMILTON, CLERMONT, CENTRAL BROWN AND SOUTHERN HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 115 AM EDT... At 1243 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Blanchester to Coldstream to near Oakbrook, moving southeast at 55 mph. Winds will become gusty out in front of the storm. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Covington, Florence, Independence, Erlanger, Fort Thomas, Edgewood, Alexandria, Elsmere, Fort Mitchell, Highland Heights, Hillsboro, Taylor Mill, Fort Wright, Georgetown, Southgate, Crestview Hills, Lakeside Park, Claryville, Oakbrook and Forestville. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 176 and 185. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
